name: Days Inn Albany SUNY

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Centrally located, decent rooms for the price, friendly staff. It's perfect for 1 or 2 nights where all you need a room for is to sleep and shower.
reviews.title: Fine for an overnight stay.

reviews.text: Very clean, good value. Restaurant/pub
reviews.title: Perfect stay!

reviews.text: Next door very good. Dunkin donuts attached for am needs. If your looking for a place to lay your head and take a hot shower this is ur place. $85 per night
reviews.title: I wouldn't give it ANY stars

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Without a doubt, the worst experience EVER in a hotel. I booked online and made a copy of my reservation. A non-smoking, double queen room. I give my confirmation # to the girl at the front desk and she looks and looks and looks and says...gee, I see your reservation but you're already checked in! OH REALLY? I'm standing in front of you, 20 mins after the earliest time you can check in, and she already has me checked in? Well, she has NO idea how this happened or WHO is in my room...turns out after lying to my face for over half hour and she indeed checked some "regular" into my room, used MY booking information INCLUDING CREDIT CARD. Imagine she checks someone into a room with no ID or credit card on file and then lies consistently about it. I kept asking her who checked her in..I don't know...I don't know...she then goes to check to see if someone is actually in the room. while she is gone another employee told us our credit card was linked to the room with a stranger in it and that the girl who "didn't know anything" was the only person working the front desk all day. the girl returns to tell us someone is indeed in our room and to make up for her mistake, she offers to upgrade me to a non smoking double queen room because she said we had a king room reserved..I said to her LOOK at the reservation! you're upgrading me to a room I had reserved already.. maybe the "regular" had reserved a king room, i certainly didn't. She then offers to adjust the price so I decide to take her offer and when I get to the room, it reeked of cigarette smoke so badly, that was the last straw. I went and said forget it, I want my money back. NEVER in my life have I encountered such scam artists and liars such as this bunch. I would play double not to stay in a dump like this. Bad enough you have a front desk clerk lying about everything she did, you have a hotel manager defending her lies and security breaches. Needless to say, I cancelled my credit card the second I left this dump. There are plenty of hotels in Albany..find another that doesn't try to steal your personal info and share it with their "daytime" regulars....
reviews.title: Okay for One Night

reviews.text: We booked the Days Inn very last minute via Priceline as a stopover on our road trip to Boston from Toronto.
reviews.title: DECENT VALUE

reviews.text: The best things I can say about this property are that it is clean, and that it's right next to a Dunkin' Donuts. Here are the inadequacies: (1) no elevator; (2) wireless was virtually non-functional when I was there; (3) it smelled musty; (4) there were no washclothes in the bathroom; and, (5) the breakfast was all starch - no protein (not even yogurt). I won't stay here again.
reviews.title: Cleanliness can't overcome the inadequacies

reviews.text: Our family of 4 drove into the area to fly out of Albany and needed a one-night stay but didn't want to pay too much for a couple hours of sleep. We got this hotel through Hotwire and we found it acceptable at the discounted price. If we paid full price we would have been quite disappointed based on the quality of hotel you're getting.
reviews.title: OK at a Discounted Price - Rude Receptionist

reviews.text: We called ahead and said we'd need late-check in, and asked if it was possible to get a room with 2 double beds. The guy on the phone got really huffy and said that we booked through Hotwire so we get what we get, and mentioned that if we wanted to choose our room, we should have booked through them. If find it funny because a recent previous reviewer said the exact same thing. What's with these people? People are going to ask so why not just answer nicely. However, the guy at check-in was quite friendly.
reviews.title: We'll be staying here whenever we are in this are.

reviews.text: The room we ended up getting had only 1 queen-sized bed. The room was a bit dingy and there was no bathtub, only a stand up shower. The room and hotel in general had a bit of a strange smell, like musty, pet-like odors covered up with some air freshener.
reviews.title: Good investment and location for the price

reviews.text: The free breakfast was nice to have, but I think we will try something a bit more upscale next time.
reviews.title: Simple but comfortable

reviews.text: Stayed one night (2 Rooms) on 7/21/12. Nice large, clean room. Ice cold AC,TV (hbo) 2 beds with 4 pillows each bed. Very comfortable. Nice bath with a Great shower. Free breakfast, basic but also very nice and clean. Very nice at the Front Desk. What more can you ask for? Would be a good buy at double the price.
reviews.title: Great Price---Very Clean

reviews.text: My family stayed for the week and it was to be expected for the price. One of the cheapest in the area and is dog friendly ($20 per stay). The room was clean, bathroom included. I felt the building was pretty secure (not the best neighborhood) because you needed to swipe your key to get in. The beds are comfy enough. All the staff I encountered were very friendly. Another plus is it shares a building with a Dunkin Donuts (or maybe thats a minus, haha) They also have continental breakfast (bagels, orange juice, cereal, etc) each morning. I have 2 complaints: the air conditioner and parking. The a/c did not work very well and seeing as its July, that was not good. The hallway was cold, but not the room. Second, the parking spaces I felt were too short/the road was narrow. I was nervous I was gonna get rear ended. Luckily I didn't. But overall our stay was good, nothing great.
reviews.title: You get what you pay for, good for the price

reviews.text: Nice people, management people are in direct contact, reasonable room / bath room for price, good location.
reviews.title: good hotel

reviews.text: My room was spotless and the manager was very accommodating when I had problems or needed help. The only setback was that the place needs painting, new carpets and some work on whatever is causing some spots on the ceiling. But for the money, I was pleased.
reviews.title: decent for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was worried when I'd read some of the earlier reviews, especially the ones mentioning rude staffers.
reviews.title: Perfectly nice place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose this Days Inn because of its proximity to UAlbany. I wasn't expecting the Residence Inn (which is usually our hotel of choice) and we surely didn't get it! The room was clean, the bed was comfortable and the pillows were super fluffy. However, the place could use a little work - peeling paint, wallpaper and stains. The Continental Breakfast was OK - bagels, muffins, coffee, tea, juice, etc. Fine for one or two nights and considering we spent very little time in the room, it was worth the price.
reviews.title: It's not the Marriott but you wouldn't expect it for the price!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The person at front desk is very rude and refused to accommodate any request. He refused to assign a room with 2 beds unless I pay a hefty upgrade fee. He refused to help me solve internet issue and told me that if I am not happy, I should leave. But I am too tired and it is too late( 11 PM ).
reviews.title: Worst experience ever

reviews.text: Staff was rude, no accodating what so ever. With competition out there they better treat the customers right, dont go to this hotel.
reviews.title: Lousy hotel, rude staff, bad management

reviews.text: I totally agree with the other posts..the WORST hotel experience ever- the night staff person was EXTREMELY rude, and not accommodating in the least. (I had two young children with me). The hotel was FILTHY, smelled, chipped paint everywhere. I should have just checkout out before we stayed but I was so tired and it was late (stopover on the way to Boston). I have stayed in Days Inn's before without much of a problem but this was not even a 1star.
reviews.title: TERRIBLE HOTEL

reviews.text: I stayed here in Feb '12, visiting my daughter from Ireland. Aside from a rude receptionist (who was there when I checked in but whom I never saw again during my 8 night stay, thankfully) I found the hotel to be perfect for my needs. It's cheap, no frills etc...ideal as I wasn't flush for cash as I had come to the US at kinda short notice. The breakfast could do with something other than the mass of carbohydrate that is available, but I very much enjoyed it nevertheless. Housekeeping provided plenty of coffee and clean towels. No wireless in the rooms but having worked in a hotel I know this isn't financially viable for a hotel to provide so the ethernet cable was fine. Staff were helpful, hotel is in a great location when you're relying on public transport. Hotel were also very accommodating when my daughter had to stay a couple of nights at short notice and provided a roll-out.
reviews.title: Cheap and Cheerful

aka: Days Inn Albany Guilderland Hotel Albany
